A new series of fun little challenges, levelled from 1 to 10 covering all aspects of fundamental parkour.

ðŸŽ¯ Upwards

Vaulting Challenge - Cat-Pass 2

Demonstrate that you can perform a cat-pass up onto a higher level. You can use some stairs, a bench, short wall, block or raised platform that is higher that knee height.

Perform the cat-pass placing your hands on the higher level and then landing your feet on the same level.

You must repeat five times at the same height or greater.

Palms must be flat with no steepling of the fingers and the thumb facing forwards.

No twisting onto one side. This is a bilateral movement where both sides of your body should be doing the same motion at the same time.

-- Rules of Challenge --

Rule 1 description : The height of the stairs/block/wall must be knee-height or greater.
Rule 2 description : Both sides must be performed together. No twisting
Rule 3 description : Five repetitions.
Rule 4 description : Both feet together on the inside of the hands.
Rule 5 description : Takeoff both feet together.
Rule 6 description : The hands should be in a flat position, with the full palm touching. No steepled fingers or thumb tucked behind, raising the palm.
